structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases

law.catch_line: Woods; Wanton Or Reckless Injury Or Destruction By Fire
law.text: Whoever by wantonly or recklessly setting fire to any material, or by increasing a fire already set, causes injury to, or the destruction of, any growing or standing wood of another shall be punished by a fine of not more than one thousand dollars or by imprisonment for not more than two years.
